image.altText: A woman with white hair pulled back wearing glasses sits in the drivers seat of a car holding the wheel, looking serious.

props.synopsis: Finding a parking sport at Canberra Hospital is an ongoing challenge for some regular visitors, and with a new emergency department opening last month patients are concerned the parking situation will worsen.

title.children: 'I've had enough': Wanda parks illegally when taking her mum to the Canberra Hospital

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entrance.

props.synopsis: Jessie Gould pleaded guilty to more than 30 charges in the ACT Magistrates court related to a string of thefts in Canberra's north, after being caught by police hiding in a wardrobe following his failure to turn up to court.

title.children: Canberra man identified by fingerprints on stolen car's steering wheel freed

image.altText: Two men holding booklets entitled "The Integrated Energy Plan'' stand in front of  a back drop with "ACT Government'' logos.

props.synopsis: With an ACT election just six weeks away, tension between Labor and the Greens has developed into a public spat.

title.children: How friction between ACT Labor and the Greens developed into a public spat

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks to media, as seen in an AI video

props.synopsis: Showing how easy it is to make deepfakes of politicians using artificial intelligence, independent senator David Pocock creates AI videos of Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton.

title.children: 'This is not technology we can stop': David Pocock posts AI deepfakes of Albanese and Dutton as warning ahead of election

image.altText: Lauren Parker and James Turner parade with the Australian flag at the Stade de France

props.synopsis: Australia's flag-bearers James Turner and Lauren Parker have paraded around the Stade de France and Paris bids au revoir. Follow live.

title.children: 'Let's keep daring': Turner and Parker fly the flag as closing ceremony caps off Paris Paralympics

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Now it is time to party in Paris
Paralympic flag is handed over to Los Angelels

image.altText: A composite image of a broadcasting tower with a sign reading "ten" and an image of a woman with blonde hair smiling.

props.synopsis: Network Ten reporter Tegan George's bid to sue her employer over trauma she says she suffered covering the bushfire season in 2019 and 2020 ends in a confidential settlement.

title.children: Network Ten reporter Tegan George reaches settlement with broadcaster over bushfire trauma

image.altText: Blue sky can be seen above a row of apartments.

props.synopsis: ACCC chair Gina Cass-Gottlieb says commissions are driving up the cost of insurance as Four Corners exposes the hidden arrangements lining the pockets of brokers and strata management firms at the expense of apartment owners.

title.children: Insurance giant channelled undisclosed kickbacks to strata management firms

image.altText: Kamala Harris smiles and points at something above her in the distance, in front of a crowd.

props.synopsis: It has been a dream start to Kamala Harris's bid for the White House, and supporters are confident she'll beat Donald Trump in the popular vote — but the Electoral College is a different story.

title.children: Kamala Harris has a blue state dilemma that could cost her the election

image.altText: Patchy snow slope with mounds of dirt dotted through it

props.synopsis: Tourism operators and the broader Snowy Mountains region are looking to summer tourism options as they face the prospect of warmer winters and shorter ski seasons.

title.children: This year's ski season ended far earlier than usual, prompting soul-searching among operators

image.altText: a person holding a rainbow flag

props.synopsis: Questions on both sexual orientation and gender will feature in Australia's next census, as the federal government seeks to repair the fallout from earlier efforts to abandon questions about LGBTIQ+ identity.

title.children: 'LGBTIQ+ Australians matter': Sexual orientation and gender questions to feature in next census

image.altText: A man and woman hugging in front of a for sale sign at a house

props.synopsis: As the government returns to parliament to pick a new fight on housing, new figures reveal a third of first home buyers are using federal support for help to buy a home.

title.children: A third of first home buyers are leaning on government for help to put down a deposit

image.altText: Real estate agent puts up a sold sticker after this Mosman apartment sold at auction.

props.synopsis: Politics and timing are inextricably linked — sometimes, the Zeitgeist suits your story, other times it doesn't. Kamala Harris and Bill Shorten both know that the hard way.

title.children: Is Australia finally ready to say goodbye to negative gearing?

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walks into court.

props.synopsis: The former Liberal staffer has been given extra time to file amended grounds of appeal, as he seeks to overturn the result of his failed defamation case.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer defends missed deadlines in attempt to overturn defamation ruling

image.altText: A close up of Paddy Hoy wearing ski gear and standing in a store.

props.synopsis: It's not just older generations who think younger people are doing it tough. The list of people concerned about the impact of inflation on households includes economists, the boss of the Commonwealth Bank, Matt Comyn, and the Reserve Bank.

title.children: 'It's just tough to be young': How inflation, interest rates and economic reality have collided for younger generations

image.altText: A Telstra payphone in a remote setting with trees and grass

props.synopsis: Taxpayers and telcos spend nearly $300 million a year to guarantee access to landlines and payphones, even though fewer and fewer people are using them.

title.children: The little-known 'dinosaur' policy that could be holding us back from better phone coverage

image.altText: a map of new south wales with markers showing the locations of people who reported feeling an earthquake

props.synopsis: With the NSW Hunter Region in the midst of an "earthquake swarm", and mining found to have caused tremors overseas, could it be the cause here too?

title.children: Is mining causing the NSW earthquakes? Here's what a seismologist has to say

image.altText: A road sign reading "King Hussein Bridge Border Crossing" with an armoured vehicle behind it.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says a truck driver opened fire at an Israeli border crossing between the occupied West Bank and Jordan on Sunday, killing three Israeli guards before security forces shot him dead.

title.children: Gunman from Jordan kills three Israelis at West Bank border crossing, Israeli army says

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek stands behind Anthony Albanese at a press conference

props.synopsis: The federal government's plans to establish an environmental protection agency have hit a political impasse, calling into question whether the election commitment can be met before the end of this term of parliament.

title.children: Labor hitting political impasse seeking to establish environment cop

image.altText: A man and a woman looking over paperwork with a calculator and computer

props.synopsis: In the United States, Americans can split or average out their income with their partner to reduce the tax they pay. Could this be adopted in Australia?

title.children: Do you earn more than your partner, and would sharing income save on tax?

image.altText: Lachlan Murdoch

props.synopsis: In a polarised media world, it's never been more important to understand Lachlan Murdoch.

title.children: My attempt to find the truth about the powerful but enigmatic media mogul, Lachlan Murdoch

image.altText: Generic photos of apartments, balconies

props.synopsis: If we reformed the tax system, and made housing more affordable, would monetary policy work more fairly?

title.children: Is it the Reserve Bank's fault that some people might have to sell their homes?

image.altText: Primoz Roglic celebrates on the podium with a trophy after winning the Vuelta a Espana

props.synopsis: Slovenia's Primoz Roglič sealed a record-equalling fourth Vuelta a España title while Australian Ben O'Connor finished second.

title.children: Aussie O'Connor finishes second at La Vuelta as Roglič claims fourth crown

image.altText: A red four-wheel-drive is crushed by falling tree branches

props.synopsis: Officials warn that despite the typhoon's waning power, significant flooding is still possible in the aftermath of the typhoon.

title.children: At least 21 killed in Vietnam as threat from Typhoon Yagi continues

image.altText: Man wearing white shirt surrounded by people pointing mobile phones at him

props.synopsis: Prosecutors issue an arrest warrant for Edmundo Gonzalez in connection with the online publication of election result tallies.

title.children: Venezuela opposition candidate leaves takes asylum in Spain amid election fallout

image.altText: Pope Francis sits next to a microphone and holds papers

props.synopsis: Pope Francis was greeted by dancers adorned with feathers and brightly-painted faces, signing traditional hymns.

title.children: Thousands gather for 'once-in-a-lifetime' experience of holy mass with Pope Francis in PNG

image.altText: Actress Nicole Kidman with her mother Janelle Ann Kidman as they attend the 2018 AACTA Awards

props.synopsis: The Australian actress leaves the film festival after learning the news her mother had died aged 84.

title.children: Nicole Kidman reveals mother's death in Venice Film Festival acceptance speech

image.altText: A teen checks her Twitter notifications.

props.synopsis: Social media giants would be forced to ban children under the age of 14 from their platforms or face hefty penalties, under proposed laws in South Australia that could be replicated in other states.

title.children: 'Big, massive deterrent': Social media companies could face fines for allowing kids under 14 on their platforms

image.altText: A young boy in a spiderman outfit with a grey picture in the background of people searching a bush.

props.synopsis: A decade after the boy in the Spider-Man suit vanished from his foster grandmother's home on the NSW Mid North Coast, police are no closer to finding him.

title.children: Why we may never know what happened to William Tyrrell

image.altText: Two workers in Hi-Vis on a crane working on a powerline.

props.synopsis: More financial assistance has opened up for Tasmanians affected by the recent storm and flooding event, as residents continue assessing the damage.

title.children: 'Unprecedented scale of damage': Disaster relief grants of up to $10,000 announced by Tasmanian premier

image.altText: A person in a blonde mullet adjusts their wig.

props.synopsis: After growing up on a sheep station, the film was one of the first places Tom Henderson saw people who were "Queer, happy and thriving". Now, he performs as drag queen Amanda Screetly and credits the film for helping shape the culture of Broken Hill.

title.children: How the 'beautiful gift' of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert brought outback drag dreams to life

image.altText: Cars driving along a road in the city.

props.synopsis: Point-to-point speed cameras, which calculate a driver's average speed between two points, will be switched on for all vehicles travelling on the Pacific Highway between Kew and Lake Innes and the Hume Highway between Coolac and Gundagai.

title.children: Average speed cameras to be trialled for cars in regional NSW

image.altText: A group of rugby league players celebrate a try

props.synopsis: A few moments of Kalyn Ponga brilliance have delivered Newcastle a 14-6 win over the Dolphins and ensured the Novocastrians will claim the final spot in the top eight for 2025. See all the match-ups for the first week of the NRL finals here.

title.children: Kalyn Ponga stands tall as Knights down Dolphins to secure finals berth

image.altText: Two plumes of dark grey smoke rise from a low skyline.

props.synopsis: Sudan rejects a call by UN experts for the deployment of an "independent and impartial force" to protect civilians driven from their homes by more than a year of war.

title.children: Sudan rejects UN call for 'impartial' force to protect civilians after year of war

image.altText: A graphic shows a woman with a blurred face looking at a mobile phone with a message above her.

props.synopsis: After a university student was bombarded with doctored, sexually explicit images of herself, the abusive comments started. So did a plan to bring down the perpetrators of what one expert describes as a problem so rife in South Korea it is "national disaster".

title.children: It started with a flood of 'ominous' texts. Then Ruma saw her face on fake porn images

image.altText: A man, Brett Button, standing in a crowd of people with news cameras surrounding him

props.synopsis: Ten people died when the bus Brett Andrew Button was driving crashed on the way home from a wedding. This week he is expected to receive a jail term, but not before hearing from dozens of the victims' family and friends and those who survived the crash.

title.children: Hunter Valley bus crash driver to come face to face with devastated loved ones of those killed
